column2: CA DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column6: signal.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 2. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column6: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column8: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.

column2: 3. There is one lane in your direction and the vehicle ahead of you often slows down for no apparent reason. In this situation you should:
column4: increase the following distance between you and the other vehicle.
column6: flash your headlight quickly to alert the other drivers.
column8: pass the vehicle as soon as possible.

column2: 4. A curb painted blue means parking is:
column4: allowed for no longer than 15 minutes.
column6: for picking up or dropping of passengers.
column8: for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.

column2: 5. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column4: fix
column6: replace
column8: work with

column2: 6. With a Class C drivers license a person may drive:
column4: A 3-axle vehicle if the Gross Vehicle Weight is less than 6,000 pounds.
column6: Any 3-axle vehicle regardless of the weight.
column8: A vehicle pulling two trailers.

column2: 7. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: U-turns are not allowed.
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column8: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 8. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column6: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: reduce the minimum following distance.

column2: 9. You hit a parked vehicle and can’t find the owner. What must you do?
column4: Wait for the owner to return.
column6: Leave a note with your name and address on the parked vehicle.
column8: Call your insurance company when you get home.

column2: 10. You have consented to take a test for the alcohol content of your blood, breath, or urine:
column4: only if you have been drinking alcohol.
column6: whenever you drive in California.
column8: only if a collision has occurred.

column2: 11. You have been involved in a minor traffic collision with a parked vehicle and you can't find the owner. You must:
column4: Leave a note on the vehicle.
column6: Report the accident without delay to the city police or, in unincorporated areas, to the CHP.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 12. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: stop if necessary.
column6: watch for workers crossing the road.
column8: None of the above.

column2: 13. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop.
column6: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 14. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: Slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
column6: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
column8: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.

column2: 15. Which of the following is true about safety belts and collisions?
column4: Safety belts keep you from being thrown clear to safety, which lowers your chances of surviving collisions.
column6: Safety belts increase your chances of survival in most types of collisions.
column8: Safety belts are unnecessary if your vehicle is equipped with front and side airbags.

column2: 16. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: A cold remedy.
column6: Marijuana.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 17. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column6: Replacing worn wiper blades.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 18. A large truck is driving in the middle of three lanes. You want to pass the large truck. It is best to pass:
column4: very slowly on the left and move ahead of it.
column6: quickly on the left and move ahead of it.
column8: very quickly on the right and move ahead of it.

column2: 19. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: anticipate errors by other drivers.
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

column2: 20. A school bus ahead of you in your lane is stopped with red lights flashing. You should:
column4: Stop as long as the red lights are flashing.
column6: Slow to 25 MPH and pass cautiously.
column8: Stop, then proceed when you think all of the children have exited the bus.

column2: 21. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the speed limit on that route.
column6: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column8: the type of route you are on.

column2: 22. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column6: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 23. You are about to make a left turn. You must signal continuously during the last ____ feet before the turn.
24. Animals may be transported in the back of a pickup truck only if:
column4: the tailgate of the truck is closed.
column6: the sides of the truck bed are at least 18 inches high.
column8: they are properly secured.

column2: 25. The safest precaution that you can take regarding the use of cellular phones and driving is:
column4: Review the number before answering a call.
column6: Use hands-free devices so you can keep both hands on the steering wheel.
column8: Keep your phone within easy reach so you won't need to take your eyes off the road.

column2: 26. Which of the following statements about blind spots is true?
column4: Blind spots can be checked by looking in your rear view mirrors.
column6: They are eliminated if you have one outside mirror on each side of the vehicle.
column8: Large trucks have bigger blind spots than most passenger vehicles.

column2: 27. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: race on empty roads.
column6: share the lane with another vehicle.
column8: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 28. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 29. These are:
column4: speed limit signs.
column6: miles-left signs.
column8: route signs.

column2: 30. At 55 mph, it takes about ____ feet to react and bring the vehicle to a complete stop.
31. Allow extra space in front of your vehicle when following a:
column4: large tour bus.
column6: station wagon.
column8: passenger vehicle.

column2: 32. Select the best answer. Before changing lanes, you should:
column4: look over your shoulder to check for blind spots.
column6: look into your rear view mirror.
column8: look into your rear view mirror, and also over your shoulder.

column2: 33. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column6: wear approved helmets.
column8: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 34. Following closely behind another vehicle (tailgating):
column4: is a common cause of rear-end collisions.
column6: helps keep traffic moving.
column8: increases fuel efficiency.

column2: 35. A school bus with its red lights flashing is stopped ahead on your side of the road. You must:
column4: slow to 25 MPH and proceed with caution.
column6: stop until the lights stop flashing.
column8: stop until all the children have left the bus.

column2: 36. You see a pedestrian with a white cane at the corner ready to cross the street. The person takes a step back and pulls his/her cane. You should:
column4: stop your vehicle a minimum of six feet from the crosswalk and wait for the person to cross the street.
column6: proceed across the street because the person is not ready to cross.
column8: honk your horn to let the person know when to crosswalk and wait for the person to cross the street.
